Start.Content: Welcome to the Ship System Tutorial

StateA.Content: StarMade uses a system to quickly calculate ship systems and their connections, as well as groups of a particular blocks.

StateB.Content:
A lot of systems work best in block-groups. A block-group consists of two or more blocks of the same type that are all touching each other.
A solid big cube of blocks is an example of a block-group, but the same goes for a line.

StateC.Content:
For some systems, it is more efficient to arrange the groups in a certain way.
The power recharge system uses this type, allowing the player to construct a powerful reactor as efficient as possible.

StateD.Content: In this case, the dimension of the block-groups matter. This means that a solid big cube of recharge power modules gives a lot less energy than the same amount of blocks, laid out in a giant three-dimensional cross.

StateE.Content:
Another example for block-groups are the weapon modules. Each group of weapons will fire one projectile.
You can either have one big group, or multiple weaker small ones. Keep in mind that you'll receive a penalty, depending on how many separate weapon groups you have.

End.Content: This concludes the Ship System Tutorial. Thanks for reading, and thanks for playing StarMade!
